section.title: Knowledge Editor
section.para: The Knowledge application is organized into 2 areas: Editor and Manager. The manager is only available to administrators, so we will lay out the Editor functionalities in this article.

The Editor is an interactive application that allows you to search, view, edit, and create terminologies, reference sets, and search criteria. By default, it is divided into 2 sections: the task pane and the concept viewer pane. When you select a concept on the left task pane, its details can be viewed in the right details pane.
Figure of the Knowledge Editor layout as described above.
You can optionally open another concept viewer pane that will display on the far right side of the window. There are three ways to do so:
Right-click the concept you wish to review and select "open in new concept viewer".
Highlight the concept you want to see in a new viewer and press " keyboard shortcut tbd, e.g. ctrl+alt+n " to open a new concept viewer.
In the top navigation pane, select "Authoring", then "Launch Third View".

section.title: What can I do in the Editor?
section.para: The Editor has tasks divided under 2 interfaces: Authoring and Export Management. You can access either of these interfaces in the top navigation anytime you are logged into the Editor.

inlinemediaobject.alt: Figure of the Knowledge Editor navigation with the interfaces highlighted

section.para: The application indicates which area and interface you are working with on the upper left corner.

section.title: Authoring
section.para: The Authoring interface provides information on concepts and terminologies, lists reference sets, queries, mapsets, enables user to run the classifier, and allows user to search for items in the database. Depending on your account permissions, there is also the ability to edit many of the previously mentioned items.

section.title: Export Management
section.para: The Export Management interface is viewable by users who have Editing permissions. Tasks such as QA runs, content releases, metric reports, and conflict resolutions is done under this interface, but the Content Manager has permissions to create a release version in this area.
